topics.body:
Want to hear something cool?  Clinical trials on a spiral implant to help bridge damage to your spinal cord are starting soon.

Basically the idea is bridge the gap in a broken spine.

"News story on it":http://rt.com/news/221567-implant-paralyzed-walk-test/

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54cac7f563687256250b0400#post_54cac7f563687256250b0400
The other reason why it's important is that the number one reason why we don't have machine replacements for limbs that can perform just as well as human limbs is that we don't currently have a way of directly attaching to the nervous system therefore current biomechatronic devices have poor ability to respond to the user. With this new technology it might soon become possible for biomechatronic devices to directly link to the nervous system for far better control.

*. . . . . .*
*REGLAS DE LA NATURALEZA*
!http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/689/549/f53.gif!
